bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: a) with an inability to speak as a major sign. This may be a congenital birth defect, or the result of some later illness. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 refers to “muteness” with the singular character ya 啞 once only. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 154 ：言遲語吃，或啞或聵，神氣昏 塞，此心形之不備也 , “Slow speech, and stuttering, muteness and deafness, with clouding and obstruction of the spirit qi, results from an incomplete forming of the physical appearance of the heart”.
b) Identical with ya 瘂 , muteness disease. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 uses ya 啞 in binomes interchangeably with ya 瘂 , as for example in ya bing 啞病 , muteness disease, and sheng ya 聲啞 , muteness.
